div.p: J64/9136, unit 119, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

A quantity of the seeds of the Blue Gum tree is ready to be shipped to the Madras Government by next mail
On 23 July 1864 the Secretary to Government, Madras wrote to the Chief Secretary, Melbourne requesting a supply of seeds of different forest trees indigenous to Victoria. The costs of collecting and shipping the seeds were to be paid by the Madras Government. The Under Secretary ofthe Chief Secretary's Department, J. Moore, referred the file to M on 12September. M had been informed of thesum availableby the Governor (see acknowledgement on M to H. Warde,27 August 1864), and requested the necessary financial advance in M toJ.McCulloch, 9 September 1864.
The total advance had not been spent by January 1865, see M to J. McCulloch, 19 January 1865, and notes thereto.
